alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 07 at 10:52PM CST until February 08 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Gusty Winds and Low Relative Humidity Tuesday... .Gusty winds up to 40 mph are expected from the northwest starting mid morning Tuesday with relative humidity dropping quickly during the early afternoon hours. Although relative humidity is currently forecast to be slightly higher than criteria, the combination of the stronger wind gusts and lack of precipitation recently will cause concern for rapid fire growth along and east of a Culbertson, Nebraska to Hoxie, Kansas line. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 003...004...015... 016 AND 081... * Affected Area...In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 003 Decatur... Fire Weather Zone 004 Norton...Fire Weather Zone 015 Sheridan and Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham. In Nebraska...Fire Weather Zone 081 Red Willow. * Winds...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 16 percent. * Temperatures...Around 60. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. No significant change in wind direction is expected.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
